tablesaw.addons.java
Class JavaProgram

java.lang.Object
  tablesaw.addons.java.JavaProgram

public class JavaProgram
extends java.lang.Object

The JavaProgram class simplifies the creation of rules for building a Java program. By default after calling setup() JavaProgram creates two JavaCRules - one for the source and one for the test code - a JarRule and a SimpleRule for building javadocs. The defaults for the source and build directories can be changed by calling Tablesaw.setProperty(String, String) using the appropriate property defined in the static members of this class. They can also be set by adding them to your own custom tablesaw.properties file. The defaults can be overridden by calling the appropriate set method before calling setup().

Constructor Detail

JavaProgram

public JavaProgram()
            throws TablesawException
Creates an instance of JavaProgram. No rules are created until setup() is called. By default JavaProgram uses the name of the parent directory as the program name.

Throws:
TablesawException

getProgramName

public java.lang.String getProgramName()
Returns the program name.

setProgramName

public JavaProgram setProgramName(java.lang.String programName)
Sets the name of the program. This name will be used when creating the jar file. For example if you program is named HackTV then the jar file will be named HackTV.jar.

Parameters:
programName - Name used for the resulting jar file.
Returns:

setSourceDirectory

public JavaProgram setSourceDirectory(java.lang.String sourceDir)
Sets the name of the java source directory.

Parameters:
sourceDir - Java source directory such as src/main/java.
Returns:

setClassDirectory

public JavaProgram setClassDirectory(java.lang.String classDir)
Sets the name of the directory to which the class files are built.

Parameters:
classDir -
Returns:

setRulePrefix

public JavaProgram setRulePrefix(java.lang.String prefix)
Sets the prefix for all rules created by JavaProgram. The rules created are named and can create conflicts if you are building more than one JavaProgram in a single build script.

Parameters:
prefix -
Returns:

noTests

public JavaProgram noTests()
Disables creation of a compile rule for test classes. This is used when compiling multiple modules that have a common test directory.
